titleStmt.title: Ignatius his conclaue or his inthronisation in a late election in hell: wherein many things are mingled by way of satyr; concerning the disposition of Iesuits, the creation of a new hell, the establishing of a church in the moone. There is also added an apology for Iesuites. All dedicated to the two aduersary angels, which are protectors of the Papall Consistory, and of the Colledge of Sorbon. Translated out of Latine.
Conclave Ignati. English
titleStmt.author: Donne, John, 1572-1631.

titleStmt.title: Ignatius his conclaue or his inthronisation in a late election in hell: wherein many things are mingled by way of satyr; concerning the disposition of Iesuits, the creation of a new hell, the establishing of a church in the moone. There is also added an apology for Iesuites. All dedicated to the two aduersary angels, which are protectors of the Papall Consistory, and of the Colledge of Sorbon. Translated out of Latine.
Conclave Ignati. English
titleStmt.author: Donne, John, 1572-1631.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by N[icholas] O[kes] for Richard Moore, and are to be sold at his shop in S. Dunstones Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: The title page has a rule border.
The first leaf and G9-11 are blank; G12 is an additional title page ina different setting, with an ornamental border; it is normally cancelled, as reflected in the pagination above.
Reproduction of original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
